info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 13 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, western Massachusetts and southern Vermont, including the following areas, in northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield County. In western Massachusetts, Berkshire County. In southern Vermont, Bennington and Windham Counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM EDT this evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of small rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains, sewers and ditches may become clogged with leaves. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storm total rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches with isolated higher amounts are possible. Rainfall rates may approach an inch an hour with heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms. These amounts of rainfall could lead to urban and poor drainage flooding and the possibility of isolated flash flooding, if repeated rounds of heavy rainfall occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
